Great question! 🌍 The greenhouse effect is a natural process that keeps Earth warm enough to support life. It happens when certain gases in the atmosphere trap heat from the sun—just like a greenhouse traps warmth for plants! 🪴

👉 How does it work?

☀️ The sun sends energy (sunlight) to Earth.

🌎 Earth absorbs some of this heat and reflects the rest back.

🌫️ Greenhouse gases like CO₂ (carbon dioxide), CH₄ (methane), and water vapor trap some of the heat in the atmosphere.

🌡️ This keeps the planet warm—around 15°C on average.

Without it, Earth would be too cold to live on!

👉 Causes of Extra Greenhouse Gases:

🚗 Burning fossil fuels (coal, petrol, diesel)

🏭 Factory and industrial emissions

🔥 Deforestation (cutting trees)

🐄 Agriculture (methane from cows)

🌫️ Excessive use of electricity and transportation

👉 Benefits of the Natural Greenhouse Effect:

🌱 Keeps Earth warm enough for life

💧 Maintains water in liquid form

🌦️ Supports weather and climate systems

❌ Problems with the Enhanced Greenhouse Effect (Global Warming):

🌡️ Earth's temperature is rising (climate change)

🧊 Melting glaciers and rising sea levels

🔥 More heatwaves, wildfires, and droughts

🌪️ Extreme weather events (storms, floods)

🐧 Threat to animals, plants, and humans

👉 Solutions to Reduce the Greenhouse Effect:
✅ Use renewable energy (solar, wind, hydro)
✅ Plant more trees (afforestation)
✅ Reduce car and air travel – use public transport 🚲
✅ Save electricity – turn off lights, use energy-efficient appliances
✅ Recycle and reduce waste
